vscp.module:
rawEthernet Modtronix SBC68EC test module A 0.0.1 2011-02-19 This is a test module to show the possibilities with raw Ethernet to create low cost control modules. http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/smart_relay_control_-_intelligent_relay_control_module 8 eurosource Brattbergav√§gen 17 Los 82050 Sweden +46 730 533146 Main Reception support@eurosource.se Support email sales@eurosource.se Sales inquires email info@eurosource.se General email http://www.eurosource.se Main web site 0 8 4096 Zone Zone this module belongs to rw Subzone Subzone this module belongs to. Subzone base for I/O. Lowest 5 bits should be zero (ignored) and are used for I/O pins and other zoned functionality.
 
 0 - General subzone for module.
 
 1 - subzone for Input 0.
 2 - subzone for Input 1.
 3 - subzone for Input 2.
 4 - subzone for Input 3.
 5 - Reserved.
 6 - Reserved.
 7 - Reserved.
 8 - Reserved.
 
 9 - subzone for Output 0.
 10 - subzone for Output 1.
 11 - subzone for Output 2.
 12 - subzone for Output 3.
 13 - subzone for Output 4.
 14 - subzone for Output 5.
 15 - subzone for Output 6.
 16 - Reserved.
 
 17 - subzone for pin PWM Output.
 
 18 - subzone for A/D 0.
 19 - subzone for A/D 1.
 20 - subzone for A/D 2.
 21 - subzone for A/D 3.
 22 - Reserved.
 23 - Reserved.
 24 - Reserved.
 25 - Reserved.
 
 26 - Subzone for serial channel.
 
 27 - Subzone for temperatire sensor.
 
 28 - Subzone for led.
 29 - Reserved.
 30 - Reserved.
 31 - Reserved.
 rw Reserved This register is reserved for future use. rw Subzone Module Control Register. Note on PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT
 If you want to write just a persitent value for the PWM and after that current PWM values that should not be persistent. Enable this bit, write a value and the reset the bit again. This will load the PWM with the value written when the bit was set on the next startup.
 For Output/Input events CLASS1.DATA TYPE=1 (I/O) is sent with data coding set to 0x20 This means the frame get the content 0x20 in it's first byte and output status in it' second byte. Vref- selection Enable external Vref- on RA2. Vref+ selection Enable external Vref+ on RA3. Reserved Reserved PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT Make PWM value persistent. Reserved ENABLE_PERIODIC_OUTPUT_EVENTS Enable Output periodic events. ENABLE_PERIODIC_INPUT_EVENTS Enable Input periodic events. Reserved Auto event interval in seconds. Set to 0 to disable autoevents. rw Input status Current input status for input bits 0-7. rw Output status Current output status for input bits 0-7. rw A/D periodic A/D Control Register periodic events control register. Set corresponding bit in this register to enable periodic events. rw A/D alarm low. Aanalog to digital control register for low alarm. Set corresponding bit in this register to enable low alarm. This means an alarm event will be sendt out when the corresponding A/D channel has a value below a certain value. rw A/D alarm high. Aanalog to digital control register for high alarm. Set corresponding bit in this register to enable high alarm. That means an alarm event will be sent out when a high A/D value has been exceeded. rw Output Control Register 0 The output control bits enable disable intelligent output functionality. rw Initial state Initial startup state for output channel.
 1 = high, 0=low. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Protection timer enable. If this bit is set to one a protection timer will reset it if it has not been externally reseted before a timeout period. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Enable If set to one the output is enabled. Disabled output stays at initial state. Output Control Register 1 The output control bits enable disable intelligent output functionality. rw Initial state Initial startup state for output channel.
 1 = high, 0=low. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Protection timer enable. If this bit is set to one a protection timer will reset it if it has not been externally reseted before a timeout period. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Alarm event enable Sends an alarm event when input goes to a high state. Off event enable Send Off event when input goes to low state. Off event enable Send on event when input goes to high state. Output protection timer 0 MSB This is the most significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed. Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay. rw Output protection timer 0 LSB This is the least significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed. Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay. rw Output protection timer 1 MSB This is the most significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed. Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay. rw A/D converter 0 MSB Most significant byte for analog to digital converter 0 r A/D converter 0 LSB Least significant byte for analog to digital converter 0 r A/D converter 1 MSB Most significant byte for analog to digital converter 1 r A/D converter 1 LSB Least significant byte for analog to digital converter 1 r A/D converter 2 MSB Most significant byte for analog to digital converter 2 r A/D converter 2 LSB Least significant byte for analog to digital converter 2 r A/D converter 3 MSB Most significant byte for analog to digital converter 3 r A/D converter 3 LSB Least significant byte for analog to digital converter 3 r PWM value MSB. Most significant byte for the pwm channel. The read/written value is in the range 0-1023. Both values has to be written to actually set the PWM. The data is transfered to the PWM register when the LSB byte is written. The value here is normally not persistent so a reset will write zero. However it is possible to make it persistent by enabling the PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT in the module control register. Values greater the 0x3ff written to the PWMregisters will be masked to appropriate value. r PWM value LSB. Least significant byte for the pwm channel. The read/written value is in the range 0-1023. Both values has to be written to actually set the PWM. The data is transfered to the PWM register when the LSB byte is written. The value here is normally not persistent so a reset will write zero. However it is possible to make it persistent by enabling the PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT in the module control register. Values greater the 0x3ff written to the PWMregisters will be masked to appropriate value. r Serial channel control register This register is used to set communication parameters for the serial channel. rw Baudrate Baudrate for the serial channel http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/rawethernet#serial_channel
300 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 300 baud.
1200 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 1200 baud.
2400 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 2400 baud.
4800 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 4800 baud.
9600 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 9600 baud.
19200 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 19200 baud.
38400 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 38400 baud.
57600 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 57600 baud.
115200 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 115200 baud.
230400 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 230400 baud.
460800 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 460800 baud.
921600 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 921600 baud. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This register is reserved for future use. rw Serial channel control register. This register has control bits for the serial channel. rw Enable confirm events. Enable confirm events. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Enable serial stream to channel. Enable serial stream events output to serial channel. Enable serial stream from channel. Enable serial stream events on input from serial channel. Serial port open. Port open status. Set to one to open zero to close port. Read to see if open/closed. Serial persistent open. Persistent open/close. Set state for port when board is started. A/D min value 0 MSB. Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 0 LSB. Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 1 MSB. Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If high alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw Alarm hysteresis Alarm hysteresis for high and low A/D alarms are set in this register. rw Current temperature Current temperature, MSB. r Current temperature sensor 1 Current temperature, LSB. r Absolute high temperature Absolute high temperature, MSB. Writing any value to this register resets absolute high temp. rw Absolute high temperature Absolute high temperature, LSB. Writing any value to this register resets absolute high temp. rw Absolute low temperature Absolute low temperature, MSB. Writing any value to this register resets absolute high temp. rw Absolute low temperature Absolute low temperature, LSB. Writing any value to this register resets absolute high temp. rw Running mean of temperature Running mean of temperature sensor 1, MSB. Writing any value to this register resets absolute high temp. rw Running mean of temperature Running mean of temperature sensor 1, LSB. Writing any value to this register resets absolute high temp. rw Temperature low alarm point 255 mean no alarm and is the default value. This value is read and written degrees Celsius. Note that the value stored in his register is the real value not the 100* value used for other registers. rw Temperature high alarm point 255 mean no alarm and is the default value. This value is read and written degrees Celsius. Note that the value stored in this register is the real value not the 100* value used for other registers. rw Temperature ensor Status register rw Temp Event Interval for temperatur sensor Time in seconds between temperature events for temperature sensor. (0 is no temperature event, 30 is default). rw Temperature format. Select the format used for temperature measurements rw
Kelvin Temperature values will be given in Kelvin.
Celsius Temperature values will be given in Celsius (default)
Fahrenheit Temperature values will be given in Fahrenheit Temperature calibration value Temperature calibration value for sensor, MSB. Set a signed value to calibrate sensor. Default is 0. rw Temperature calibration value sensor 1 Temperature calibration value for sensor, LSB. Set a signed value to calibrate sensor. Default is 0. rw Hysterisis for temperature alarm Hysterisis for temperature alarm (default is five degrees Celsius). rw Output protection timer 0 This is the least significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.
 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay. http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/modules/nova#output_protection_time_registers rw Output protection timer 1 This is the least significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.
 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay. http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/modules/nova#output_protection_time_registers rw A/D Converter 0 Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read. r A/D Converter 1 Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read. r A/D Converter 2 Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read. r A/D Converter 3 Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read. r PWM channel 0 Value for PWM 0 channel. The value here is normally not persistent so a reset will write zero. However it is possible to make it persistent by enabling the PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT in the module control register. Values greater the 0x3ff (1023) written to the PWMregisters will be masked to appropriate value. rw A/D min value 0 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 1 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 2 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 3 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 4 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 5 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 6 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D min value 7 Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected. rw A/D max value 0 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw A/D max value 1 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw A/D max value 2 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw A/D max value 3 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw A/D max value 4 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw A/D max value 5 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw A/D max value 6 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw A/D max value 7 Maximum value for analog to digital converter. If a high alarm is enabled an alarm event will be sent when a value above this point is detected. rw Temperature sensor Current temperature r High temperature Absolute high temperature. Write any value to reset. rw Low temperature Absolute low temperature sensor. Write any value to reset. rw Mean temperature sensor 1 Running mean of temperature sensor 1. Write any value to reset. rw A/D High/Low Alarm. A/D High/Low Alarm. Read status register to reset. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Reserved This bit is reserved for future use. Temperature low alarm. Set when temperature goes below low temperature alarmpoint. Temperature high alarm. Set when temperature goes above high temperature alarmpoint. Alarm condition. Alarm condition has occurred. Lower bits indicates whta has happened. Read alarm register to reset. http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/rawethernet#available_actions 2 16 32 NOOP No operation Activate output(s) Activate output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on. Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action. Activation array A bit array where a bit should be set for bits at output that should be activated. Activate output(s) Deactivate output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on. Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action. Activation array A bit array where bit should be set for bits at output that should be deactivated. Send serial data Send data in argument on serial port. Data should be NULL terminated. Serial data A zero terminated string that is sent on the serial channel. Send file Send data if file on filesystem. The file should be compiled in as on of the files that build up the web pages. Datafile Filename for datafile on filesystem. Open serial port Open serial port Close serial port Close serial port Reserved Reserved for future use. Reserved Reserved for future use. Reserved Reserved for future use. Send Output status. Send Output status. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on. ON/OFF events are sent. Send Input status. Send Input status. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is input 0 and so on. ON/OFF events are sent. Send A/D value(s). Send A/D value(s). The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is A/D 0 and so on. A/D event is sent. Send Output status. Send Output status. I/O event is sent instead of ON/OFF events as of above. Send Input status. Send Input status. I/O event is sent instead of ON/OFF events as of above. ROM Write Set PWM as of argument. Byte 0 is MSB, Byte 1 is LSB. On event If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its active state. Index Always set to zero. Zone The zone for the input/output. subzone The subzone for the input/output. Off event If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its inactive state. Index Always set to zero. Zone The zone for the input/output. subzone The subzone for the input/output. Stopped If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its inactive state. Index Always set to zero. Zone The zone for the input/output. subzone The subzone for the input/output. Started If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its active state. Index Always set to zero. Zone The zone for the input/output. subzone The subzone for the input/output. Alarm If enabled the event is sent when a output goes to its low state after a protection timer have timed out or when an input goes to a triggered state.Can also be sent when the temperature go above a high level or uner a low level. Index Always set to zero. Zone The zone for the module. subzone The subzone for the input/output. I/O value I/O measurements are sent with this event. Datacoding The datacoding is set to integer and is 0b01100xxx where xxx = 0 for inputs and xxx = 1 for outputs. I/O value The actual data as a single byte integer. A/D value A/D measurements are sent with this event. Datacoding The datacoding is set to integer and is 0b01100xxx where xxx is index for A/D converter. A/D value MSB MSB of A/D reading. A/D value LSB LSB of A/D reading. Node Heartbeat Node heartbeat send out. Index Always set to zero. Zone Module zone. Subzone 0 (subzone for module). Stream Data with zone. Use this event to send serial data to the serial channel of the module. Also this event is sent from the module when data is received on the serial channel. Confirm events are sent when stream data is received. Zone Module zone. Subzone Subzone for serial channel. Sequency number The sequency number is increased for every event of this type that is sent. Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent. Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent. Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent. Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent. Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent. Temperature measurement The temperature is reported as a normalized integer value by this event. 4 format format is the measurement data coding format described in the VSCP specification Bits 5,6,7 is set to 0x08 - Normalized integer format. Bits 3,4 0x00 - Kelvin, 0x01 ‚Äì Celsius, 0x02 ‚Äì Fahrenheit. Bits 1,2,3 0x00 for sensor 1, 0x01 for sensor 2. exponent This value is always 2 meaning two decimals. Temperature value MSB of normalized integer. Temperature value LSB of normalized integer. /events>
